tweet: I strongly disagree with the Supreme Court’s decision to allow construction of the president’s border wall to proceed. This is not a real solution to fixing our broken immigration system. The American people deserve comprehensive reforms and I continue to fight for that.

Proud that the House passed the #ButchLewisAct. Millions of workers in our country who paid into multiemployer pension plans are at risk of losing their retirement savings. This legislation will ensure that they receive the benefits they earned.

While 9/11 First Responders have waited far too long for this, I’m happy to see my colleagues in the Senate pass this legislation. 

I look forward to seeing the 9/11 Victim Compensation Fund permanently authorized. https://twitter.com/AP/status/1153754908077805569 …

Wishing my dear friend and colleague, @RepJohnLarson, a wonderful birthday today. Working with you to strengthen Social Security and create a fairer tax code for the American people continues to be a joy. pic.twitter.com/A7KDHJRBCi

While we are currently experiencing the longest period of economic expansion in our country's history, wages have not kept up with rising costs of living. I'm proud to vote in favor of increasing the minimum wage and assuring workers that there is dignity in their work.
It’s also worth noting that six out every 10 minimum wage workers are women. By passing the #RaiseTheWage Act, we also help chip away at the wage gap in our country.

Raising wages doesn’t just improve the lives of workers. It also improves the lives of their families. By passing the #RaiseTheWage Act, 600,000 children across this country will be lifted out of poverty. We owe it to the next generation to pass this legislation.

I'm proud to join an overwhelming bipartisan group of my colleagues in voting to repeal the Cadillac tax.

By doing so, we help ensure that middle-class families can continue to have access to quality, affordable health care coverage. pic.twitter.com/8cvuCnAaW8

The last thing a nursing home patient and their family wants to do is worry about their legal rights when they enter into a long-term care facility. That's why I'll soon be reintroducing legislation to eliminate binding mandatory pre-dispute arbitration. https://bit.ly/2JCVqWv

It’s important that the House vote today to condemn the president’s racist comments and tweets. 

Let’s not also forget that House Dems will vote this week on the #RaiseTheWage Act, which will raise wages for 34 million workers and lift 1.3 million Americans out of poverty.

Not only is seeking asylum a legal right, but those coming from the Northern Triangle are fleeing unimaginable violence and death threats.

This decision to turn our backs on those looking for refuge in the United States is heartless and un-American. https://apnews.com/6bef9ed6c48b4c2ea203cbbea3ccacad …

Attacks like this show everyone just how small minded our president is. Growing up, I remember the sting of hearing people tell my immigrant parents to go back to Mexico. It’s wrong and it runs counter to the values that truly make our country great. https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1150381394234941448 …

The House recently passed the 2020 National Defense Authorization Act. 

I’m proud that the final #NDAA included paid family leave for members of our military, the highest raise for our troops in over 10 years, and no funds for the president’s border wall.

We cannot turn our backs on the 9/11 first responder community. I could not be more proud to cosponsor and vote for legislation to #Renew911VCF, helping these heroes and their families for as long as they need it. pic.twitter.com/JCmd1Fm3dZ

En preparación para las deportaciones masivas, usted debe saber que tiene el derecho a:

▪️No abrir su puerta a menos que el agente de inmigración tenga una orden de allanamiento valida.
▪️Permanecer en silencio.
▪️No firmar ningún documento.
▪️Hablar con un abogado.

In light of the planned ICE raids this Sunday, know that you have the right to:

▪️Not open the door unless the immigration agent has a valid search warrant.
▪️Remain silent.
▪️Not sign any papers.
▪️Speak to a lawyer.

Be prepared. Have Important Documents Ready. #KnowYourRights pic.twitter.com/8b9nEwR2ZM
As ICE plans to launch nationwide family separation raids, it's important to #KnowYourRights no matter your status. https://twitter.com/HispanicCaucus/status/1149678935107678208 …
It’s infuriating that he’s more focused on attacking immigrant communities than improving the lives of the American people.
The president’s planned raids this weekend as well as his illegal executive order to add a citizenship question to the census demonstrate just how misguided his priorities are.

Today, I proudly introduced a bipartisan resolution with over 100 co-sponsors to designate July 10, 2019, as Journeyman Lineman Recognition Day. Don't forget to #ThankALineworker for their hard work and sacrifice!

A packed house today as the @WaysMeansCmte considers the #ButchLewisAct. America’s workers show up each day and work hard. It’s time we show up for them by passing this bill and protecting multi-employer pensions. pic.twitter.com/0MJJr1Xlj3

Americans who worked hard and paid into pensions for retirement should not have the rug pulled out from under them. That’s why Dems are fighting for legislation to shore up multiemployer pension plans. It’s time to pass the #ButchLewisAct. pic.twitter.com/hpMUYM9iSf

❌Leave roughly 20 million Americans uninsured.
❌End protections for those with pre-existing conditions.
❌Increase health care costs for working families.

Congrats @USWNT on an incredible World Cup win today. You inspire us all to push ourselves to new heights. ⚽️ 🇺🇸 🥇

On this #IndependenceDay, let’s remember that what truly makes our country great. It’s our desire to work towards a more perfect union and treat all people with dignity and equality. I wish everyone a happy 4th of July and hope it’s spent with friends and loved ones. 🇺🇸
